Description: Fragment of strap handle of a pottery transport amphora, gradual curve. Clay fine buff. Irregular rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 175,5. Trimmed. The trimming seems to have removed letters seen by Petrie on the right. While his readings are not fully reliable (pi is unclear in line 2 and omega is far preferable to nu in line 1) it is difficult to reject his alpha and sigma at the ends of the lines, however problematic in the former case. Peloris is a known name, frequently found on Pamphylian stamps, but no attested example presents any name similar to that in line 1. C. Brixhe, Timbres amphoriques de Pamphylie, Paris 2012.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1727)
